description_txt: stated on May 29, 2015 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: "In just 17 years, spending for Social Security, federal health care and interest on the debt will exceed ALL tax revenue!"

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2015 in a social media post:
quote_txt: Says Bill Clinton "gave a speech in 1996 about Iraq having WMDs" and said "we needed a regime change," even though everyone blamed those things on George W. Bush.

description_txt: stated on June 2, 2015 in a statement on a web page.:
quote_txt: Says Scott Walker runs a state government that bans "employees from talking about climate change."

description_txt: stated on June 13, 2015 in a campaign rally speech:
quote_txt: "The top 25 hedge fund managers (are) making more than all of America's kindergarten teachers combined."

description_txt: stated on June 11, 2015 in an interview on PBS:
quote_txt: "A black male baby born today, if we do not change the system, stands a one-in-three chance (of) ending up in jail."

description_txt: stated on May 20, 2015 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: "Twenty-five percent of people in the country have said they changed their email and phone habits because of" the collection of data allowed by the Patriot Act.

description_txt: stated on June 5, 2015 in press conference:
quote_txt: Ninety-seven percent of Americans do not receive subsidies for health care under the Affordable Care Act.

description_txt: stated on June 4, 2015 in an interview.:
quote_txt: Millennials "will be 75 percent of the workforce in the next 10 years."

description_txt: stated on June 14, 2015 in comments on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: Says Jeb Bush "happens to be where a majority" of Republican voters are on giving legal status to illegal immigrants.

description_txt: stated on June 14, 2015 in comments on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton's "been very clear where she stands on trade."

description_txt: stated on May 6, 2015 in a hearing at the General Assembly :
quote_txt: "The profit [from automated traffic enforcement cameras] is going to the private corporations, not to the city or state."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • June 14, 2015

description_txt: stated on June 7, 2015 in a segment about bail on "Last Week Tonight":
quote_txt: Says "Florida is a model" for successful pretrial release programs.

description_txt: stated on June 2, 2015 in a speech:
quote_txt: Thanks to the Act 10 collective bargaining law that took effect four years ago, ACT scores in Wisconsin "are now second-best in the country for states where more than half the kids take the exam."

description_txt: stated on June 8, 2015 in a press release:
quote_txt: The film and TV industry supports more than 24,000 direct jobs and pays local workers more than $1.68 billion in wages in Georgia.

description_txt: stated on June 4, 2015 in an interview with Chris Cuomo:
quote_txt: "In Muslim countries, under the Sharia, there is a death penalty for blaspheming Mohammad."

description_txt: stated on June 2, 2015 in a speech at Gov. Rick Scott's Economic Growth Summit in Orlando:
quote_txt: "In Florida, for eight years we cut taxes every year, totaling $19 billion."

description_txt: stated on May 28, 2015 in a speech:
quote_txt: A Republican budget proposal "would have Wisconsin have the weakest standards for who can be a teacher in the classroom in the country."

description_txt: stated on June 5, 2015 in an interview on CNN's "New Day":
quote_txt: The New York Times "had to retract" its story that Hillary Clinton’s email handling had broken certain laws.

description_txt: stated on June 6, 2015 in social media posts:
quote_txt: "U.S. Embassy Celebrates America’s Independence on June 4th in Order to Accommodate Muslims."

description_txt: stated on May 22, 2015:
quote_txt: Since Republicans took over after the 2010 election, "the graduation rate in Wisconsin has gone from 86 percent to 88 percent. The black graduation rate has gone from 60 percent to 65 percent. The Latino graduation rate has gone from 65 percent to 71 percent."

description_txt: stated on June 5, 2015 in televised story:
quote_txt: Georgia residents file the most insurance claims for lightning strikes in the country.

description_txt: stated on June 4, 2015 in a speech:
quote_txt: Says Scott Walker "cut back early voting and signed legislation that would make it harder for college students to vote."

description_txt: stated on June 4, 2015 in in a speech at Texas Southern University:
quote_txt: "In Florida, when Jeb Bush was governor, state authorities conducted a deeply flawed purge of voters before the presidential election in 2000" and "in 2004 a plan to purge even more voters was headed off."

description_txt: stated on June 4, 2015 in a speech:
quote_txt: "Former Gov. Rick Perry signed a law that a federal court said was actually written with the purpose of discriminating against minority voters."

description_txt: stated on June 4, 2015 in a speech:
quote_txt: "In New Jersey, Gov. Christie vetoed legislation to extend early voting."

description_txt: stated on June 8, 2015 in a "Washington Post" article:
quote_txt: 47 percent of Americans "can’t pay for an unexpected $400 expense through savings or credit cards, without selling something or borrowing money."

description_txt: stated on May 19, 2015 in yard signs posted anonymously opposing a proposed office park redevelopment in Northwest Austin:
quote_txt: "500 percent more traffic here?"

description_txt: stated on June 2, 2015 in a speech at Gov. Rick Scott's Economic Growth Summit in Orlando:
quote_txt: "We reduced the government workforce by 13,000, 11 percent, during my eight years."

description_txt: stated on June 2, 2015 in a press release:
quote_txt: "Our reserves are now in much better shape than they were just a few years ago."

quote_txt: On Common Core.
